attributes.action: We ask for David Cameron to Step down over his proud disabled benefit cuts
attributes.additional_details: Mr Cameron seems to have a short memory to how important this money is to peoples lives who suffer with the day to day struggle of having a disability and has turned his back on voters who put his party into government. We now have no confidence in Mr Cameron or his government for the lack compassion that has been show to the poorest and most vulnerable in society and ask for him to step aside as prime minister over his many broken election promises if Mr Cameron a new general election should be called to let the country decide his future
attributes.background: Mr Cameron's government has continually be imposing further and further cuts to money to the poorest and worst off in society even though his family has received disabled themselves.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision to stand down or resign is a matter for the individual involved and not the UK Government and Parliament as a whole.
